intro: Cuphea curiosa var. curiosa, commonly known as the curious cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, spiky inflorescences. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This ornamental plant is popular in gardens for its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
